creditline: National Museum of the American Indian
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: carved mask, representing a bear; human nose and mouth with two rounded ears placed atop head; two full rows of shell teeth; inlaid pupils; small faces carved within ears; bears facing each other forms eyebrows; tufts of black hair along top edge; main pigment color blue-green over face
medium: Wood, hair, opercula, abalone, hide, cotton thread, sinew, nails
title: Bear Mask
